bartMachine

Class bartMachine_g_mh

  • java.lang.Object
    • bartMachine.Classifier

  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    bartMachine_h_eval

    public abstract class bartMachine_g_mh
extends bartMachine_f_gibbs_internal
    This portion of the code performs the Metropolis-Hastings tree search step
    Author:
    Adam Kapelner and Justin Bleich

    • Method Detail

      • metroHastingsPosteriorTreeSpaceIteration

        protected bartMachineTreeNode metroHastingsPosteriorTreeSpaceIteration(bartMachineTreeNode T_i,
                                                           int tree_num,
                                                           boolean[][] accept_reject_mh,
                                                           char[][] accept_reject_mh_steps)
        Performs one Metropolis-Hastings step for one tree
        Specified by:
        metroHastingsPosteriorTreeSpaceIteration in class bartMachine_e_gibbs_base
        Parameters:
        T_i - The original tree to be changed by a proposal step
        iteration_name - we just use this when naming the image file of this illustration (debugging only)
        Returns:
        the next tree (T_{i+1}) via one iteration of M-H which can be the proposal tree (if the step was accepted) or the original tree (if the step was rejected)

      • doMHGrowAndCalcLnR

        protected double doMHGrowAndCalcLnR(bartMachineTreeNode T_i,
                        bartMachineTreeNode T_star)
        Perform the grow step on a tree and return the log Metropolis-Hastings ratio
        Parameters:
        T_i - The root node of the original tree
        T_star - The root node of a copy of the original tree where one node will be grown
        Returns:
        The log Metropolis-Hastings ratio
        See Also:
        A.1 of Kapelner, A and Bleich, J. bartMachine: A Powerful Tool for Machine Learning in R. ArXiv e-prints, 2013

      • doMHPruneAndCalcLnR

        protected double doMHPruneAndCalcLnR(bartMachineTreeNode T_i,
                         bartMachineTreeNode T_star)
        Perform the prune step on a tree and return the log Metropolis-Hastings ratio
        Parameters:
        T_i - The root node of the original tree
        T_star - The root node of a copy of the original tree where one set of terminal nodes will be pruned
        Returns:
        The log Metropolis-Hastings ratio
        See Also:
        A.2 of Kapelner, A and Bleich, J. bartMachine: A Powerful Tool for Machine Learning in R. ArXiv e-prints, 2013

      • pickPruneNodeOrChangeNode

        protected bartMachineTreeNode pickPruneNodeOrChangeNode(bartMachineTreeNode T)
        This function picks a node suitable for pruning or changing. In our implementation this is a node that is "singly internal" (ie it has two children and its children are both terminal nodes)
        Parameters:
        T - The root of the tree we wish to find singly internal nodes
        Returns:
        A singly internal node selected at random from all candididates or null if none exist

      • calcLnTransRatioGrow

        protected double calcLnTransRatioGrow(bartMachineTreeNode T_i,
                          bartMachineTreeNode T_star,
                          bartMachineTreeNode node_grown_in_Tstar)
        Calculates the log transition ratio for a grow step
        Parameters:
        T_i - The root node of the original tree
        T_star - The root node of the proposal tree
        node_grown_in_Tstar - The node that was grown in the proposal tree
        Returns:
        The log of the transition ratio
        See Also:
        A.1.1 of Kapelner, A and Bleich, J. bartMachine: A Powerful Tool for Machine Learning in R. ArXiv e-prints, 2013

      • calcLnLikRatioGrow

        protected double calcLnLikRatioGrow(bartMachineTreeNode grow_node)
        Calculates the log of the likelihood ratio for a grow step
        Parameters:
        grow_node - The node that was grown in the proposal tree
        Returns:
        The log of the likelihood ratio
        See Also:
        A.1.2 of Kapelner, A and Bleich, J. bartMachine: A Powerful Tool for Machine Learning in R. ArXiv e-prints, 2013

        Calculates the log transition ratio for a grow step

        protected double calcLnTransRatioPrune(bartMachineTreeNode T_i,
                           bartMachineTreeNode T_star,
                           bartMachineTreeNode prune_node)
        This calculates the log transition ratio for the prune step.
        Parameters:
        T_i - The root node of the original tree
        T_star - The root node of the proposal tree
        prune_node - The node that was pruned
        Returns:
        The log transition ratio
        See Also:

        protected bartMachineTreeNode pickGrowNode(bartMachineTreeNode T)
        Selects a node in a tree that is eligible for being grown with two children
        Parameters:
        T - The root node of the tree to be searched
        Returns:
        The node that is viable for growing

      • doMHChangeAndCalcLnR

        protected double doMHChangeAndCalcLnR(bartMachineTreeNode T_i,
                          bartMachineTreeNode T_star)
        Perform the change step on a tree and return the log Metropolis-Hastings ratio
        Parameters:
        T_i - The root node of the original tree
        T_star - The root node of a copy of the original tree where one node will be changed
        Returns:
        The log Metropolis-Hastings ratio
        See Also:
        A.3 of Kapelner, A and Bleich, J. bartMachine: A Powerful Tool for Machine Learning in R. ArXiv e-prints, 2013

      • calcLnLikRatioChange

        private double calcLnLikRatioChange(bartMachineTreeNode eta,
                          bartMachineTreeNode eta_star)
        Calculates the log likelihood ratio for a change step
        Parameters:
        eta - The node in the original tree that was targeted for a change in the splitting rule
        eta_star - The same node but now with a different splitting rule
        Returns:
        The log likelihood ratio
        See Also:
        A.3.2 of Kapelner, A and Bleich, J. bartMachine: A Powerful Tool for Machine Learning in R. ArXiv e-prints, 2013

      • randomlyPickAmongTheProposalSteps

        protected bartMachine_g_mh.Steps randomlyPickAmongTheProposalSteps()
        Randomly chooses among the valid tree proposal steps from a multinomial distribution
        Returns:
        The step that was chosen
